thread.title: NFL roundup: Another 4-0 start for Peyton Manning - Football
thread.title_full: NFL roundup: Another 4-0 start for Peyton Manning - Football - NorthJersey.com

author: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS |
title: NFL roundup: Another 4-0 start for Peyton Manning - Football
text:
Buy this photo ASSOCIATED PRESS Vikings quarterback Teddy Bridgewater getting sacked by Denver OLB DeMarcus Ware, left, and DE Malik Jackson. Von Miller smothered a loose football after T.J. Ward’s sack-strip of Teddy Bridgewater in the closing seconds, sealing the Broncos’ 23-20 win over the Minnesota Vikings on Sunday in Denver.
It was the seventh sack of the afternoon for the unbeaten Broncos (4-0), who got a 72-yard touchdown run from Ronnie Hillman and broke a 20-20 tie with a 39-yard field goal by Brandon McManus with 1:51 left.
Peyton Manning has led his teams to a 4-0 start seven times, the most in NFL history. Next up at four is Fran Tarkenton. Manning also joined Brett Favre as the only QBs to win 100 home starts.
SAINTS 26, COWBOYS 20, OT (at New Orleans) — Drew Brees hit C.J. Spiller with a short pass that the running back turned into an 80-yard touchdown — the 400th of the Saints quarterback’s career — on the second play of overtime.
Brees, who missed New Orleans’ previous game because of a bruised rotator cuff in his right (throwing) shoulder, completed 32 of 39 throws for 279 yards in his return.
Mark Ingram gained 126 yards from scrimmage for the Saints.
RAMS 24, CARDINALS 22 (at Glendale, Ariz.) — Todd Gurley rushed for all but five of his 146 yards in the second half and St. Louis handed Arizona its first loss of the season.
Gurley, the Rams’ first-round draft pick, saw his most extensive action as a pro, and his 52-yard run set up what proved to be the winning touchdown.
Rams QB Nick Foles threw for three touchdowns.
CHARGERS 30, BROWNS 27 (at San Diego) — Given a second chance due to a penalty, rookie Josh Lambo kicked a 34-yard field goal as time expired to snap San Diego’s two-game losing streak.
Lambo was wide right on a 39-yard attempt with two seconds left, but Cleveland’s Tramon Williams was whistled for offside. Lambo then hit his third field goal of the game.
The Browns (1-3) had tied it at 27 on Josh McCown’s 1-yard pass to Gary Barnidge with 2:09 to play and a two-point conversion pass. 
PACKERS 17, 49ers 3 (at Santa Clara, Calif.) — Aaron Rodgers passed for 224 yards and a touchdown, ran 17 yards to set up a key second-half score, and Green Bay started 4-0 for the first time in four years.
Richard Rodgers caught a 9-yard touchdown pass on the game’s opening drive before Rodgers got his team going in the second half.
FALCONS 48, TEXANS 21 (at Atlanta) — Devonta Freeman scored three touchdowns and Atlanta remained unbeaten.
Freeman, who took over as the starting running back after rookie Tevin Coleman sustained a rib injury in Week 2, has scored six TDs in the last two games. The Falcons improved to 4-0 for only the fourth time in club history.
BENGALS 36, CHIEFS 21 (at Cincinnati) — Andy Dalton added to his streak of impressive games and big plays, throwing a 55-yard touchdown pass on the run, and Cincinnati stayed unbeaten.
The Bengals (4-0) matched the third-best start in franchise history, two wins shy of the club record.
Dalton completed 17-of-24 for 321 yards with the long TD pass to Brandon Tate during a scramble.
A man from Springfield, Mo., collapsed in a restroom during the game and was pronounced dead at a hospital. Bengals spokesman Bob Bedinghaus said the fan had a preexisting medical issue.
PANTHERS 37, BUCCANEERS 23 (at Tampa, Fla.) — Cam Newton threw for two touchdowns and Josh Norman returned one of Carolina’s four interceptions of Jameis Winston for his second TD of the season.
